newsitem.title: CHINA: China approves 1.1 bln yuan in power bonds.
newsitem.headline: China approves 1.1 bln yuan in power bonds.

text.p: China's State Planning Commission has approved the issue of about 1.1 billion yuan ($132 million) in bonds to finance development of the power industry, the China Daily said on Thursday.
Sales of the bonds would start soon nationwide, it said, quoting an official of lead manager Guotai Securities Co. It gave no other details of the issue.

"Money collected from the bond issue will be used to finance 12 large and medium-sized power projects which will be operational next year," the newspaper quoted a Ministry of Power Industry official as saying.
The plants were priority projects that were expected to yield high economic returns upon operation, he said.
China issued two electric power bonds in 1992 with a total value of 3.0 billion yuan.
